photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Number 8 combo with cornbread. Brisket, ribs and pulled pork.

92Uh23x9ZOEj8na6N_VNFg.text: I had a city dining card for a free hoppin' john and I heard nothing but good things about this place so I figured my boyfriend and I would give it a whirl. It was an awesome experience.   Right when we walked in the door we were greeted by one of the owners. He asked us if we had ever been there before (which we have not) and then proceeded to explain their southern style BBQ and let us taste test all of the home made BBQ sauces. My boyfriend and I loved the hot mustard and spicy tomato based BBQ sauces. I also really enjoyed the tang at the end of the Carolina vinegar based sauce.   I ordered a pulled chicken sandwich, coleslaw, Mac and cheese and the hoppin' john (rice, beans and collard greens mixed). My boyfriend ordered coleslaw and the beef brisket sandwich. Both of our sandwiches were tender and delicious. We both added the coleslaw on top of our sandwiches, which gave them a nice twist. The Mac and cheese was delicious- not too creamy but with a lot of flavor. I loved the coleslaw- it was processed very thin and was packed with flavor. The hoppin' John was delicious as well- I probably wouldn't have ordered it if I didn't have a card for a free one though-I'm not a huge bean fan. The collard greens gave it a nice southern twist.   The customer service was great, the food was awesome and I LOVED that they serve vegan and vegetarian options- what other BBQ joint in the burgh offers smoked tofu? My only issue was the bun- it fell apart pretty easy making the sandwich a little difficult to eat. Other than that, it was an awesome experience and I would definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hoppin&#39; john
Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coleslaw :)
Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled chicken sandwich

_X7198G_wNhO35gT-4NNzQ.text: DRY sums it up!    I keep wondering if we went to the same YinzBurgh BBQ because all the other reviews on Yelp and TA are so positive.  We ordered the brisket, ribs and pulled pork combo and honestly the ribs were the only item worth eating.  The brisket and pulled pork were so dry there was no chance to eat it without sauce, as we were told Southern BBQ should be.  The food was served barely warm as well and this was at 6:30 in the evening, high time for dinner.  The slaw and cornbread were nothing to write home about.  The cornbread was served in plastic wrap, is this the correct way?  Friendly service though but never going back.

uVzQikhuxdFhfZdE3gEjhg.text: Yinzburgh catered our 2nd wedding anniversary and it was the easiest thing ever. They delivered the food hot exactly when we wanted, and the food was so delicious and easy for our guests to access. We didn't even have to return any serving/heating tools after the event. They even helped our guests know which hot sauces were vegan etc... So simple to work with, food tastes amazing!

N7ZK5AhGxH8VzlvoqqxEuA.text: Had some relatives in town and they wanted BBQ so we scoped out some places and went with this location. The lady attending the counter was very nice and let us sample all of the sauces before placing are order. I went with the pulled pork and ribs combo which was good. The pulled pork was tender-juicy and the ribs fell off the bone and not dry cooked perfect. As a side I went with the collard greens which were fine and I managed to sample the mac n cheese with a piece of beef brisket which was also good. The place inside is not very big and the location is easy to find with parking on the side and some parking out front. I don't visit too many BBQ places through the year but I know a good place to eat when I write a review on it and this place hit the spot I would gladly return to this place when in the mood for BBQ in the Pittsburgh area.

d6XAT-Zd-7Ko0Ayo8hWgbQ.text: Richard made my birthday. He's amazing.  We went you Yinzburgh Barbeque while visiting a friend that lives in town. We all lost it over how good the food was, especially the ribs. We live in New York so are used to having pretty good restaurants and this was better than any of the big names like Dinosaur or Hill Country.   Get some ribs and chat with Richard. You won't regret it.

hT_sOxwU6xmVw9F_qhlGjg.text: Just had food catered from here at a work event - couldn't have been more pleased! I don't know much about southern food, but I rarely find it to be super veg-friendly.  The collard greens were just the right mix of garlicky and vinegary, and I really enjoyed the black-eyed peas. The mac and cheese was flavorful, although the sauce had congealed somewhat by the time I got to it. The real showstopper was the smoked tofu. I know, I know, it sounds like a crazy thing to eat, even if you like tofu. But, it was really, really delicious. The smoke gave the tofu a nice skin, and it tasted woody. They captured that real smokey flavor that I haven't had since I first went veg. I'm definitely going to check this place out in person!

FiQBg3bdfAfA_0K--CeB8A.text: If you're looking for a mom-n-pop, large-portioned, southern style barbecue joint you've found it. Phenomenal.

UfJR6XJ1-6pELPN_ythxpg.text: CM and I got takeout from here yesterday.  He went to bed with a headache last night, and both of us woke up this morning feeling sick to our stomachs.  I've had major digestive problems and have felt weak all day, and have been lying in bed for most of it.  It's now 24 hrs. later and my appetite hasn't returned.  It really saddens me to have to reduce my rating to 1 star, since this is the place that introduced me to BBQ.  However, I've eaten at hundreds of places in PGH, and this is the only one that's made me sick to my stomach.  I hope the owners take heed and fix whatever problem(s) may have caused CM's and my illness.  Unfortunately, I doubt I'll be back. :-(

JZmBeVnnz1dbJUgRKnPg0Q.text: I'm a big BBQ fan, but unfortunately YinzBurgh is only middle-of-the road. On the one hand, their meals are cheap and filling, which is great, but the BBQ isn't the best I've had. Mostly, the meat seems a bit dry.  If you are in Pittsburgh looking for BBQ, I would recommend you either try a different cuisine or come over to my place!

gfYO7Ac3f4ewi9oHVrOBxw.text: I've heard about this place a couple years ago but didn't try it til now. I got combo #10 - ribs, brisket and quarter chicken. The brisket was the best; tender, flavorful and filling. Great with the hot honey sauce. The ribs were good but mostly bones. The chicken was tasty and fell right off the bone. Got the collard greens on the side. Overall, a little pricey compared to other similar spots, and not a good sit-down place.

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Combo #10

Ouoe_GdEx_1CuD770pc-Pg.text: Stopped by for a late lunch.  Decided to try a Q-Ritos, which is Yinzburgh version of South of the border meets BBQ.  I had rice with black eyed peas and pulled pork on a flour tortilla.  Found the Q to be very good with great flavors.  The meat had a nice smoke BBQ pork taste.  A good quick meal!

Bwq0oFiBn4UBZDm5EnAPVQ.text: My absolute favorite BBQ in the east end! Great Flavor! Great sauces! Sides are great too! Best if taken out...not really a great dine-in kind of joint.

8P1_yAUegGAywoIfCGDKnA.text: I had high hopes for this place based on reviews from my fellow Yelpers, but unfortunately I did not love my recent experience here.  I had been meaning to try this place for awhile and lo and behold, I came across a Groupon (hooray for Groupon!) So the hubby and I went this past weekend. The Groupon was good for two sandwiches/wraps and two sides.  The place itself is small -- it's almost like an indoor BBQ stand. It only has a few benches for waiting and maybe four small dine-in tables. We went during dinner time, and while it wasn't packed, there was a steady stream of customers.  Our ordering experience was not great. The Groupon was good for two sandwiches and sides, but when I went to order my sandwich (pulled chicken, white meat), I was told that they were only doing dark meat chicken for the Groupon. So, two things about this. First, to exclude white meat chicken sandwiches from the Groupon seems nonsensical...the pulled chicken sandwich is $4.75 ($1.00 more for white meat)...the cheapest sandwich on the menu. So why would they exclude this? It would make them the most money from the Groupon. But second, and most importantly -- nowhere on the Groupon did it say that this was an exclusion. In fact, if it did, I may not have bought the Groupon in the first place. So, needless to say, this was annoying to learn as I was ordering.  I wasn't in the mood for dark meat, so while I was debating what to do, the owner came over and agreed to give me a white meat sandwich if I would pay the $1.00 difference. I felt like I was being nickel-and-dimed, but whatever, it was a dollar. So I said fine. But then they couldn't figure out how to charge me just a dollar on the iPad that they use as a cash register. Meanwhile, a line of customers was building up behind us. I can tell the owner was frazzled, so it probably would've been easier just to let the dollar go, but she kept trying to find a way to charge me. I finally said I would just buy a couple of drinks and some cornbread and then add the extra dollar as a tip. Problem solved, but I wasn't exactly feeling the warm customer service fuzzies here.  Next was the sauce-tasting part, but after the whole white meat chicken debacle, there was a fairly long line behind us, so the cashier went through the sauces at rapid fire speed. I didn't really have enough time to think about which one I wanted and felt rushed, so I just went with the first one I tried (the smoky and sweet BBQ).  So customer service issues aside, how was the food? Well, I ended up getting the ill-fated white meat chicken sandwich, my hubby got the brisket sandwich, and then we got mac and cheese and coleslaw for sides, plus some cornbread. My sandwich was pretty dry (which is unsurprising, since I picked the driest meat on the planet). However, what I was disappointed with was the flavor. I first tried a bite without any sauce to taste just the meat, and there really wasn't much to it...maybe a very faint hint of smokiness, but other than that, it was really bland. Once I doused the sandwich in the BBQ sauce, the taste improved dramatically...the sauce had a great balance of sweet and smoky flavor with a hint of spice. That being said, it would've been nice if the meat had a little flavor of its own that the sauce complemented, instead of having the flavor of the whole sandwich be dependent on the sauce. The other off-putting part of the sandwich was that there were a lot of bones. I understand if one or two make their way in there, but I was chomping down on a small bone like every other bite or so. It was gross pulling those out of my mouth as I was eating.  The other thing that I found odd is that we dined in, but yet we were still given little plastic cups with our sauces in them. Why not have the sauces in squeeze bottles at the tables? I understand doing it for take out orders, but if you're eating in, it would be nice to be able to use as much or as little sauce as you want (or even use multiple sauces). Plus the little plastic cups just seemed wasteful.   On a positive note, my husband loved his brisket sandwich. He reported that it was well-cooked, melt-in-your-mouth tender, and deliciously smoky. He got the hot honey mustard sauce and thought that it struck a perfect sweet-spicy balance that nicely complemented the meat.    As for the sides, they were a mixed bag. The mac and cheese was okay, but nothing special. It was flavorful, but it was kinda oily instead of rich and creamy. We both enjoyed the coleslaw the most. It was tangy, well-seasoned, and had a perfect consistency -- creamy without being too thick. The biggest disappointment was the cornbread. Although it looked appetizing, it was really dry and completely devoid of flavor.  Overall, given the Groupon debacle and the inconsistent food quality, I'd have to say that I left feeling pretty meh about the experience overall. I'm not going to be rushing back here anytime soon.

arO_x-qnUvUmS_eUaXogvA.text: I had them cater an event for me.  They arrived on time and set everything up.  There was a problem with the order, but the owner personally handled it.  No complaints there.  Was very pleased with the service.  The cost was very reasonable.  The meats are smoked and then you add the the sauce.  The brisket was most excellent.  It did not last long.  I probably should have ordered more.  The pulled pork was done to perfection.  The chicken was also a big hit.  The sauces were all quite tasty.  There is really something for everyone.    As for the sides, the black eyed peas were quite good.  The chili-Q was smash hit.  Everyone was raving about it.    Overall, an excellent job.  If you are in the mood for bbq, check out there place.  It is essentially a take out joint with a few tables for seating

X0Us-L_FU6CwhJ4JoCqW0w.text: We were in the mood for BBQ this evening and stopped by Yinzburgh. It was not to be.   There was only one party ahead of us but it took 10 minutes to take their order at the counter. There was then a delay while the woman who took the order put their order together by herself. Can't this place hire some help for a Saturday night?   Finally it was time for her to take our order. Oh wait, the phone rang and she took their order! Really?!? We should have called them instead of waiting  patiently for our turn!   It gets better. After taking the phone order, she tells us that it will be 20 minutes before she can take our order because she needs to work on a catering order. No thanks, YInzburgh. We left.  Maybe someday we will return but we will call our order ahead!

9V8LYjvdzL-3wjRZf7I7-w.text: This place is awesome. The owners are friendly, and they always recognize us when we come in. We have always enjoyed their food, especially the pulled pork with Smok'n Sweet sauce and sides (collard greens and Chili-Q), so we decided to have them cater our wedding. They gave great advice when helping us choose sides and quantities. They were so easy to work with. The price was also incredibly cheap, in terms of wedding planning. We got all this delicious food for our Pittsburgh-themed wedding at the fraction of a cost as a regular wedding catering company. We were also able to provide plenty of options for our vegetarian friends. Everyone loved it. At our wedding, I finally tried the chicken and mac and cheese, both of which were amazing.  I highly recommend YinzBurgh for both everyday meals and for catering.  Note - there isn't much seating inside, so it may be best to get food to go. You can also call ahead to order.

PnLOKFQLWAeMCu5Z66mTjg.text: Do my eyes deceive me? Is there legit barbecue in Pittsburgh?!   Going to Yinzburgh is so much easier than driving down to Georgia when you're craving good bbq. Try the pulled pork, try the ribs, try the bbq burritos! I love gorging on this restaurant's food.   Yinzburgh is truly an oddity in Oakland. Pierogies are fine, so is pizza, but where in this state can you find proper barbecue? Yinzburgh, that's where.

V-VOapirQOS_5gzj4Ja6gw.text: I just ate at this place and the BBQ is disappointing.  I could only take a few bites before I returned the BBQ.  The brisket, chicken and the pulled pork were all overcooked.  None of the meat had any flavor, it was almost like they removed flavor from the meat, and then no flavor from the rub and no flavor from the smoke.  There was no bark on the meat, how is that possible from BBQ   Sure I could have put their sauce on the meat to get some flavor but that is not good bbq, if I want meat covered up with sauce I would get a McRib at McDonalds.  I travel a lot and get the chance to enjoy a variety of BBQ around the country so maybe my standards are too high, but I am a certified KCBS BBQ judge so I have an idea of what I am talking about.

N3DKl590R4eiA2JMz9hcqw.text: I walked in wearing my Roll Tide hoodie, and that started things off on an interesting not since the owners are the real deal from the south! One grew up in Georgia and was a Georgia fan, not good for me, and her husband was an LSU fan, that went better than the Georgia part!  They were fun and gave me a full run of all their sauces so I narrowed it down to a couple mild ones and tried the brisket and the pulled pork.  Both were very good, and the serving size was generous.  It was a bit pricey, but I thought it was a fair price for the size of the serving.  Good Q ain't cheap, because it's a lot of work and takes an investment to make it right.    I had some great sides like I haven't had in awhile.  Overall a great experience and I noticed a guy delivering meat in a cooler from a local farm, Clarion Farms I think it said on his truck, very cool local sourced meet is always a good thing.    I'm always in search of good BBQ, and I enjoyed this place and will come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wow! Big serving! Real deal ya&#39;ll

wmL4BRDJY6lvVYe-DfbiMw.text: Found a free delivery deal on postmates so I chose this place having not really heard anything about it. I got the pulled pork and brisket with a side of greens. Carolina vinegar sauce was literally just vinegar so I'm not sure what they were thinking but the honey gold sauce was real good.  Everything I bought was worth the price and it all had alot of flavor. Also I got my order delivered within 15 minutes of putting it in!

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled pork and brisket Side of greens Carolina vinegar sauce Honey gold sauce

WQ766zOA0FMPOEHfMKJvyg.text: The food is delicious it's literally like down south eating!!! They let you sample any foods and their BBQ sauces. The BBQ has that amazing smoked taste- it's delicious

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

t1k4p4lMPoyfVRA5LGpLIg.text: Great home made food! Vegan option is amazing. Black eyed beans and tofu w spicy sauce is best!! Really hope they add eco options for packaging (strafoam is one of the reasons I don't go here that often) but they are very sweet! And the food is great.

QeebhsyJxSSgn9T7LEcT-g.text: We stopped today for the first time and were greeted by Deb. She asked if we had been there before and let us sample the sauces and went over the menu with us. Just before our food arrived, she brought a tray with samples of the sides they offer. What a delicious treat! We ordered the pulled pork, brisket wrap, fresh cut fries and coleslaw. I must say....I have been on the search for a place that knows southern BBQ and found it. Great food, excellent (southern) hospitality and a wonderful time. Richard even brought us a few homemade hushpuppies as a surprise at the end of our meal. Thank you Deb and Richard! It was so nice to meet and chat with you while enjoying good, southern BBQ! Stop by and see them..you and your taste buds will be so glad you did!

jEnk46x1KqjWbatMHgn_Iw.text: I called ahead and ordered a combo #1 which consisted of pulled pork and a 1/4 chicken (i chose to afterburner and the honey gold sauces). I also ordered a side of Mac and cheese and coleslaw.  The meats were not dry at all. They give you a big portion of pulled pork and the chicken was perfectly cooked. The sauces were just okay, maybe I just chose ones that I didn't really like, but I didn't really like the sauces that I chose. But the meats themselves were really flavorful and well cooked. The sides were delicious! The Mac and cheese was to die for and the cole slaw was really good.   The prices for everything can be a little steep but honestly BBQ is always a little pricey and I don't get it often, so I can't really gauge prices. However, you get a decent portion of the meats and also the sides. I think all my food including a soda came out to a total of $18? I would consider coming here again if I was in the mood for BBQ. If we were able to give half stars, I think it would be more of a 3.5 stars, rather than 4. The service was really good and the food was out fast, everyone was really polite to me over the phone and in person when I went to go pick up my food; so that's a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Combo #1 with separate side orders of Mac and cheese and coleslaw

nuSpc-hmMU3fiKYX2_YZAg.text: We were craving some good bbq and this place hit the spot! Had the baby back ribs chicken and sides. It was all so tasty!!! Meats fell off the bone. The staff is amazing and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. They put a lot of love and you can taste it!!!
Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baby back ribs. Mac n&#39; Cheese, Collard Freens and beans.

BBGnzRbtcteJP7RV1zE1FA.text: If you like good BBQ, and if you like good Southern food, then you should love Yinzburgh BBQ. This eatery is owned by the same couple that own the popular Meat Here food truck as well as the sit-down restaurant of the same name in Oakland.   Yinzburgh BBQ is not a cozy or downhome BBQ joint. It's a shopfront with some seating both inside and out. While not particularly pretty, the greatness is all in the food, and isn't that really the point?   Low and slow BBQ that even spoiled Southern eaters will enjoy heartily is what this eatery is all about. Also, they offer real-deal Southern dishes like collard greens, black eyed peas, hoppin' john and stewed tomatoes 'n okra. The last dish is what brought me to this BBQ hotspot. I really love and miss okra, and especially boiled or stewed okra, not the usual dried up fried okra that can occasionally be found up here in the North.   The stewed okra/tomatoes were wonderful and made for a delicious breakfast the next day. I had a two meat combo plate with beef brisket and pulled chicken. The brisket was flavorful but just a tad bit dry. I was very pleased that it was not cut until I ordered it. I have found that most BBQ places here in the North have the very bad habit of slicing or shredding brisket and then keeping it warm. This ruins it by rendering it dry. I enjoyed the delicious homemade spicy honey mustard sauce with my pulled chicken. What a great combo. They have about six sauces to complement the various types of meat. My second side was an unremarkable Mac and cheese. Not bad, just nondescript. Of the handful of times I've been to YinzBurgh BBQ, they have always been out of cornbread.  This might be just as well because as I'm from Texas, I prefer savory cornbread, not sweet.   This is one of the best BBQ I've eaten in Pittsburgh.

3epwu4nO4HbqXZmUF27_fQ.text: This is an ok bbq place. The meat is pretty good, but certainly not the best I've tried. Brisket and ribs both good (4/5). Chicken was nice and moist, but had some kind of funky flavour (3/5).  Sauces served on the side were fine. Corn bread was dry and stale.   The restaurant itself is a bit of a dive (to be expected I guess with bbq) but no charm. The owner was very nice and friendly.  I would go back for takeout if I needed a bbq fix!

NM4bUBbkSkNY6UWsdIifuQ.text: This place had amazing food and amazing selection of barbecue sauces and amazing owners... Was there for the first time tonight and was given red carpet treatment... Will be back again

6B2P69b_qp0qqnwURSG50w.text: This place was amazing. The sauces are all made in house and are to die for. We got a combo #7 and a side of cole slaw and Mac and cheese and it was enough to feed me and my ravenous boyfriend. Super nice people and amazing food. Everything was super moist, flavorful, and fall off the bone. The Mac and cheese was so good I could never eat Kraft again.

OcnytyI3tG84DXPzhqJ63A.text: I decided to try this place for the first time today, and it was excellent! I ordered the brisket, cole slaw, and mac n cheese. They have seven house-made bbq sauces, and the woman kindly allowed me to try them before choosing. I chose the honey-based one; itt's a nice combination of sweet, tangy and spicy!  The brisket was amazing! It was so tender I couldn't pick it up with a fork to dip into the bbq sauce. The flavor was great as well as it was cooked perfectly. I found myself scraping the bottom of the foil for all the little pieces that broke due to the extreme tenderness. At first the mac n cheese looked dry but much to my surprise, it was very cheesy and flavorful. Before leaving, the woman informed me that my mac n cheese had been freshly made which I very much appreciated. Is it better than my mom's? No, but I'll take it. And finally the cole slaw, it's mayo-based and it wasn't that flavorful. I liked that the veggies were finely chopped, but I had to add the bbq sauce for some flavor.   The physical location is not big at all, and does not have much seating. However, the good news is that they offer catering for large groups!   Whether for business or pleasure, I'll be returning to this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Medium orders of Mac n Cheese and Cole Slaw
Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small order of brisket off the bone

9v2nCn-XzGyr0-DdNOFbAQ.text: I know for a fact I've reviewed these guys before. No idea where that review is... Anyway, let's try it again: For Pittsburgh they're a five star BBQ joint (most of the time) and for other parts of the country known for BBQ they're a four. I gave an overall rating of four because on my latest visit I crunched at least four pieces of bone in my pulled chicken sandwich. Aside from that horrific experience, the smoked chicken flavor with the standard sauce had nice backyard cookout taste.  The brisket sandwich is tender with the same backyard cookout flavor.  There are several different sauces, the hottest being called "after burner", which does have a kick. But I've definitely had spicier sauces. The tomatoes and rice and tomatoes with okra are really delicious. I love, love, love the macaroni and cheese. So over the span of 6-7 visits I'd say overall it's been a good experience. And because it's within walking distance to our house, I'm sure we'll go again.

ySaWBY-_42NWU3dNvMDW5w.text: I would give them 6 stars if that was an option. Absolutely the nicest and best.   I wanted to get party platters for a 20 person party, and they worked with me on the phone to make sure it fit my budget and somewhat complicated dietary restrictions of my guests (but allergies and vegetarians). When we went to pick it up, we were treated to a taste test of all the sauces and even the sides we didn't choose.   The packing of the food was really nice and easy to transport. Nothing spilled and everything was easy to set out and serve. Plastic serving utensils were included.  The food itself was absolutely delicious. All my friends loved it and it was perfect for a party environment. (We got chicken, pulled pork, Mac and cheese and black eyed peas.) We had the perfect amount of food, so people could even get seconds.  The owner was nice enough to call two days later and check up on how everything went.  Would absolutely recommend.

CSgPhtJiArASEYPiyFwWmg.text: Wow!  I can't say enough about this place!  First of all, my experience would be best described as True Southern Hospitality . . . A taste of all of the barbeque sauces (not surprising) but also all of the sides! The food was some of the best barbeque I've ever had.  All of the sides were amazing.  All of the sauces were multidimensional.  The meat was "fall-off-the-bone".  I didn't try any of the sandwiches or wraps, but the owner did give us a taco the were trying out, and let me just say, I don't really care much for tacos but it blew my mind! The owners were so friendly and helpful.  If you're looking for excellent southern food and/or barbeque, look no further!

mh1SAy_ta8J0JVDM8xIolg.text: I have visited YinzBurgh several times since they opened, and am impressed with how they've improved over the years. On my most recent stop, I had a brisket/pulled pork combo, along with mac and cheese, and their Chili Q.  Both the pulled pork and brisket were moist and tasty, but did need BBQ sauce to punch up the flavor. If you like mustard based sauces, you owe it to yourself to try their Honey Gold sauce. The mac and cheese has always been solid (flavorful, and not greasy), but my favorite item is their Chili Q, which is chili with delicious brisket. How brilliant of a concept is that? One of my buddies had a brisket/mac and cheese wrap, which he was happy with, and I will try the next time, just because it sounds so ridiculous.  I always enjoy the food at YinzBurgh, but I think their prices are a touch high for the portions that you receive. The store is clean, and the staff is very friendly, and pretty quick, too (quickness tends to be a trait that few barbecue shops have, in my experience).  If you're in the neighborhood, and are in the mood for tasty barbecue, give YinzBurgh a try.

ssYw4dyRDjND8xlJaAt0Sw.text: I would give the highest score for this restaurant! I never write a comment on yelp, but I can't help highly recommending it! The owner let us tasted all type of the special sauce and side and even teach us culture behind each of them. We two girls ordered two combinations and surprisingly finished them all! The meat are really tasty and tender! I have to say we have never had so much meat for a meal ever before.

WSL4GgdKaesjDToUT3NUxw.text: We went in for lunch and YinzBurgh BBQ did not disappoint! We eat vegan and it was our first time here. The second we walked in, the owner greeted us, let us taste the sauces, all the vegan sides (which were all amazing), and explained the menu! The food was amazing and it came out fast! The whole staff was so fun and kind to every single person that came in. They even made a special bowl for our son! We will definitely go back and you should visit!

3tU-_RYByH1We_DGWh7kFQ.text: Tried their pulled pork with the Carolina vinegar sauce and it was excellent. The pork was super tender and tasty. Hoppin' John was very good too. We will definitely be returning!

kZBSfIvxh_dU_zCVXHDrNg.text: I used to like this place. I don't know what has happened to them lately. I picked up from there yesterday, and everything was bone-dry, like it had been smoked the day before, then refrigerated and reheated. Even the chicken was dry. Also one of my rib orders wasn't even ribs, but more like rib meat with little shards of bones mixed in throughout that was literally too dangerous to eat. Such a shame.

mTguHoo_AGZGeOtcsQh1-g.text: Don't let the outside of the place fool you. This place has excellent BBQ! It looks like a chain from outside, but they have really nailed authentic southern barbecue. Excellent meat with your sauce on the side. I went with the Carolina Vinegar - the first place outside of eastern North Carolina that I've been able to find someone that does Eastern Carolina style correctly (hint: it doesn't involve mustard in any way!).  There are some downsides. It's a little pricey, the coleslaw was boring, and there's really no room for seating (my group of 5 was split between 4 stools and a regular chair).  That all said, this place will definitely be a regular stop.

-VKiHUVLKcY_XaJGmiA6NA.text: Fantastic, been here several times.  Their food is consistently great.  So many great sauces and they'll let you sample them if you can't decide.

2hG8cMx5dKDxvWpAGZpAKg.text: After a ton of hype, I have to say this joint lived up to my expectations.  I tried the Brisket and Pulled Pork.   The Brisket was moist and broke apart so easily, very succulent.  I drenched in their signature tomato based bbq sauce which was my favorite part of the meal.   The pulled pork was good as well but the brisket was so much better.  I felt the bun on the sandwich could have  been toasted more as it was kind of dry.  I will definitely be back to try their ribs, the customer service was excellent.

1hE-GsUaX4RVXzpnAXtQNg.text: The sauces are amazing especially the mustard! Pair that with brisket and the best coleslaw I've ever had and I'm a happy camper.  Their greens are not my favorite.....which is the only reason I'd say 4 stars instead of 5.   The owner and his wife are also incredibly nice and make a real effort to know their customers.

PhzlFlVxOFzADahGqGmF9g.text: The flavors and hospitality were absolutely amazing. The only reason they did not get five stars, was  the temperature of the food. The meat came out at just above room temp and the sauce was cold.

NlZnovp6U7dEPcl_3xqbQA.text: This place is quickly becoming one of my favorite little gems in the Shadyside/East Liberty area. They have fantastic barbecue meats and a variety of really good sauces. The portions are big enough and the sides are hearty and pair with the main dishes extremely well.   Parking has never been an issue for me, but given the location I could see it being a problem at peak times. The staff has always been very friendly and helpful and they love to let you sample the different sauces and impart their knowledge of bbq on new customers to make sure they have a great experience. Not only do they serve southern cuisine, but they do so with a healthy dose of southern hospitality.  The menu is full of interesting and unique meats and sides and they even offer smoked tofu dishes for the vegan crowd to enjoy. Honestly the hardest part of going there for me is trying to figure out what I want because it all sounds and smells amazing. I usually settle on the brisket or pulled pork and have yet to be disappointed by either, so I wholeheartedly recommend those to first time visitors.   Honestly my only complaint is that they have strange hours, and more than once I've stopped by after work hoping to grab some grub to take home only to find the doors locked. If they fixed that and offered delivery this would be my favorite place in the city.

VijICCvGQ4nWji1RssoDpA.text: My husband and I went here and each ordered a combo, one with ribs and pulled pork, and the other with brisket and ribs. I can't begin to explain how delicious this barbecue was! The meat is so tender it falls right off the bone. When we got there he had us sample the five different barbecue sauces they have, then we were able to choose which sauce we would like with each dish. The restaurant isn't much to look at inside but it's so ridiculously tasty it doesn't matter. The owner is very friendly and helpful. Also - the Mac n' cheese was superb.

Q_xPVsqpocnpgohrzJ-ciQ.text: Great food friendly staff. Sampled some new additions along with the chili q. All delicious and the Mac n cheese is awesome! I love my cole slaw finely shredded and not in big chunks which is exactly how theirs is!! I like salt so I added more but you most likely won't need any! Will be back

E_cDxV6VF25Um_Ghz5OCnA.text: Drove 45 minutes out of my way for lunch after reading reviews. Only to find closed due to private event. Even though I checked website and FB page. No mention of this. Maybe they should do a better job of staffing or keeping website/ FB updated.

6zHqE16LD4up5japoEyGlQ.text: While my Partner In Cuisine (PIC) and I were wandering aimlessly around Shadyside looking for a place to have a late lunch yesterday, we decided to take the lesser traveled Baum Blvd. instead of the usual Centre Ave.  The more upscale local places weren't open for lunch so those were out.  We vetoed Ritters (not quite drunk enough to eat there), the hot foods section at Market District (avoid grocery stores the day before a holiday) and the various chain restaurants that adorn the streets of Shadyside (because chain restaurants suck.)  Tired and hungry, we walked and walked when all of the sudden in the distance, I spot a sign.  "That sign says Barbecue,"  I said.  To which the PIC promptly replied, "We are eating there."  We were so excited, we didn't even go to an intersection to cross and took our lives in our hands by crossing the four lane highway a'la "Frogger" to get to YinzBurgh BBQ.  This is not an easy task since most Pittsburgh drivers are completely psychotic (especially the PAT bus drivers.)  So we get to the restaurant and are greeted by the friendliest business owner this side of the Mason Dixon line.  Richard, the owner discussed our barbecue and sides options at length while he educated us on the "whys" and "hows" of authentic barbecue.  We got to sample the sauces and the sides before ordering, which was an extremely smart idea on his part because we ended up ordering WAY more food than we intended.  I got the ribs and pulled pork with a side of mac and cheese and the PIC got the chicken and brisket with the side of Chili-Q.  Both of us selected the signature red afterburner sauce.  Each and everything we had was excellent and we ate until our hearts content.  Of our four meats, the brisket and the ribs were the winners.  As a side note, for those non-carnivorous folks out there, there are also a plethora of vegan and vegetarian choices.     The reason why I give four stars instead of five was the lack of seating options.  If I wanted to go out with a group of friends for a good old fashioned barbecue dinner, the restaurant would not be able to seat more than a few of us.  I suppose one could get take out or delivery, but sometimes a person just wants a nice sit down meal.  Lucky for us, the day we stopped in, the weather was cooperative and we got to sit outside and dine.  If they had better seating, I think they would go far.    I also agree that the owners should just allow customers to squeeze their own barbecue sauces and try them on their meats as they eat.  In the long run, I think there would be far less waste.

r2-2O0XJBgL2q9OG5ZA1TQ.text: Good ribs. Decent brisket and pulled pork. Not my favorite chicken.  If you want some BBQ ribs - come here and get that; 5 stars in that department.

rttofBe5LiFIX2Wy_PE26w.text: It's been a year or two, and I still think these are the best ribs in town.  While Union Pig & Chicken has upped their game on most of their menu... yeah, YinzBurgh wins on the ribs.  Would gladly eat here daily if my family let me.  :-)

kjtRSc-OvX0tVsrDRSs56g.text: Great little spot in pittsburgh!  Everything made from scratch and staff dedicated to their service. They took time to have us try all their sauces before we ordered and explained their BBQ. Will be back!!

6Fol2UWOofGtkNIZBNvoTg.text: Small new BBQ place in Pitt! The owner who was very very nice and attentive to us, gave us a little history Behind why he chose to open up this place, he also explained his way of cooking all the meats! EVERYTHING made here is fresh and prepared family style and ala cart. He also let us taste all the different BBQ sauces he had which were all homemade and different from your normal everyday BBQ sauce! Unique is what comes to mind dining here.  I had the Brisket sandwich with Mac and cheese, cole slaw, Collard greens and corn bread! The meat was like butter and full of smoked BBQ flavor before adding any type of BBQ sauce! The Mac and cheese was prepared beautifully with some black pepper and was amazing .. Cole slaw was different but like I said this place is UNIQUE! The corn bread was grainy but very tasty! Over all this place will succeed because the ppl behind the counter are passionate about the food prepared and are wonderful and the food is simply on point !

photos.caption: Photo of YinzBurgh BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nYBwkdhAuGsBT3wAD1pJNg.text: Yinzburg BBQ is one place my husband, a meat-lover, and I, a vegan, can always happily agree on! The tofu q-rito is excellent. It's a generous serving, and the leftovers make for a great next-day lunch. My husband loves the chicken and the macaroni and cheese. The homemade BBQ sauces are so delicious, I really hope they start bottling them someday! This place truly has something for everyone.

YkhS4KlP3BmpL4SX-cz4Kw.text: For bbq, I give it a 4. For bbq north of the mason dixie line, I give it a 6. This is good stuff. Between two people we had chicken, ribs, brisket and pulled pork, with most of the available sauces, collards, chili, and coleslaw. For me, stand outs were the pork with vinegar sauce and the cole slaw, but everything was good enough to recommend. I will be back any time I'm near by.

gpp1I6dBD1oCBEFMzXuZGQ.text: Holy amazingly delicious! I read an article about this place not long ago and decided to try it out. So glad I did, the food was amazing! I got the pulled pork and ribs and by boyfriend got the brisket and ribs, and everything was fabulous. The owner greeted us when we entered and asked if we had been there before. Since we hadn't he gave us a little chat about the kind of BBQ he did, and allowed us to try all 5 (6?) sauces, all made in house. Our favorite was the after burner - very delicious! Then while eating the owner brought us over a sample of the smoked short ribs that would be on the menu for the weekend. All we could say was wow! I was surprised to learn Yinzburgh BBQ has been open for 2 years, and I hope they are open many more. We will be making many returns!

oEes7E-SqHEQqhI8J6svYw.text: I literally love their Mac and Cheese.  If I could swim in it, I would.  It's just so damn good.

Fug2BwUwC0HvuhZRrI-nGg.text: The service: The owner waited on us and he was extremely friendly and educational, teaching us about the different sauces and meats and how he came to starting the business. It was ready fairly quickly and wasn't too costly for the amount of food you received.  The food: The food was delicious, but I ordered a pulled pork sandwich which there wasn't any BBQ on, which I thought there would be since this is a BBQ joint. That day he said they were out of the "red sauce" so I'm only going to have to assume they had run out of the BBQ and if we wanted to wait we could have some but we were on a lunch break and couldn't afford ot wait the time. We tried the vinegar based sauce, which was very amazing and a little spicy to perfection. I am person that crazes BBQ and pulled pork and this is something that definitely gets my mouth watering. True southern style on this cooking.

ES3AwG6QQLvFsAS0G0Z_8w.text: This place is amazing.  They made their own sauces, which were offered to us for sampling as soon as we walked in.  They were really passionate and serious about their stuff.  Brisket was our faverite, tangy collard green paired nicely with all the meat.  The kids devoured their mac and cheese.  Overall this was an unexpectly nice dining experience considering this was a take-out.

1xju_-Y2TAjOjNu1PCa9Xw.text: Really awesome, falling-off-the-bones BBQ and the owner is really personable and he takes time to answer any questions you might have. He is so friendly and he always makes me feel like he really appreciates me trying anything from Yinzburgh BBQ.  I love the Afterburner sauce. I could just drink it I also like the Hot Honey. I've tried pulled pork, chicken, and ribs and they were all so delicious. As sides I've tried cole slaw, collard greens, and chili-Q. Chili-Q is something in between of baked beans and chili. It's so flavorful. The only thing for me is that it is somewhat pricy for a poor college student like me. So every time I go it's such a treat for me.

8OVyxp0gCZbTnOE2_7k3VA.text: Reconnect with traditional, primal cooking, let the subtle flavors of smoke and meat tickle your pallet unencumbered by over salted rubs and sugary sauces.  Warning: BBQ snob here who has been burned more than a few times by "awesome pittsburgh BBQ" places. If this offends you stop reading now.  Finally, real BBQ in Pittsburgh.  BBQ is a process not a sauce people! It involves cooking with smoke! If there is no smoke it's not BBQ (cough) smokey bones (cough)  The last time someone from Pittsburgh raved about a BBQ joint to me it was Clem's Hardwood Cafe... Terrible- so much heavy handed use of sauce ... i think it might have been pork i was eating? Not really sure, could have been tofu, all i tasted was the sauce.  Now enter YinzBurgh BBQ:  Good BBQ does not come out of a crock pot and is not covered in sugary sauce.  In fact, I won't be surprised to find out that this place gets a few bad reviews for not having enough sauce.  Develop a pallet people!  Anyway, the smoke flavor is nice and assertive. The rub on the smoked chicken wings is quite excellent.  I can't comment on the bread as I don't eat much bread myself and am perfectly content to chow down on a plateful of meat.  Some have complained that the meat is served too plain, however if you are a backyard BBQ enthusiast then you will appreciate the smokey flavors, which don't require heavy handed use of sauces and rubs to mask inferior cooking techniques.  If you want to sauce your meat he has a number of homemade sauces available, however this place meets my #1 criteria for BBQ: Does not require sauce, although I did enjoy dipping my meat in a bit of sauce. My one complaint would be I would want sauces on the table so I could try a little of everything.  The staff: Super friendly and we exchanged backyard BBQ tips including foiling, brining, cooking temperatures, gear... I mean this guy loves BBQ and knows his stuff and is happy to chat you up about Q. Had a great time. I hope that they are able to be successful and get into a location with some seating and of course BEER!  UPDATE:  I have revised my rating to 4 stars down from 5. If they get squeeze bottles with their sauce on the table vs forcing you to choose just one sauce then it'll go back up.

4xID9wzI9SMQU6GYYUdNoQ.text: We have now tried beef brisket at five restaurants and a couple of food trucks in Pittsburgh, and the smoked beef brisket here is above average but not the best.  It is not as flavorful as Smoq's.  The cole slaw was good and the cornbread was just okay, but the BBQ sauces we tried were the best we have tried in Pittsburgh.  We tried three sauces, and each was excellent.  I especially liked one that seemed to have a bit of chipotle flavor.  The service was friendly, and we were able to find street parking just around the corner.  If you love BBQ, you must try this place for the good brisket and outstanding sauces!

c11ltUkHrJs4Xgns0KH-Mg.text: Wow. It really doesn't get much better than this place. I'm from CNY where we have a pretty well regarded BBQ joint (Dinosaur) and my husband is from North Carolina and grew up eating tons of southern BBQ. We were bound to be tough critics. Part of my deal is I haven't eaten meat in over 10 years so my recent history with BBQ has been, well basically non-existent. Holy cow was I pumped when I found out how vegetarian friendly this place was. BBQ places in Pittsburgh are quite rare but one that has vegetarian options...shut the front door. It was too good to be True.  My husband and I, hungry for lunch and settling in for a night of drinking, thought it was as good a time as any to make our inaugural trip to YinzBurgh. We're sad we didn't go sooner. Upon walking in we were asked if it was our first time there. We confirmed it was and we were given a detailed tasting tour of all the sauces. I'm a pretty picky eater (I know right, the vegetarian is a picky eater?! no one saw that coming) but I legitimately loved all of the sauces. I really am easily annoyed when talked down to but the owner did such a great job of giving us tons of information without talking to us like we were stupid. It was a treat just tasting all of the sauces. We then placed our orders. I went with the tofu block and mac and cheese. I got to pick three sauces that went with the tofu. Seriously, delicious and fun! As our food was prepared we talked a bit with the owner. Such a nice friendly Southerner, really enjoyed him.  We got our food home and dove right in. The tofu was seriously amazing. I went with the KC sauce for it and holy crap, it was out of this world. The tofu was moist and flavorful. And the KC sauce with it was amazing. So much BBQ deliciousness in my mouth. It was heavenly, I inhaled it. The mac and cheese was sooo good. It was cheesy and rich. It was the ideal BBQ mac and cheese. I ate way too much of it.  It was a touch on the pricey side but it was worth every penny in my book. I'd go back as often as possible. Especially recommend for vegetarians, not very often that we're able to enjoy the smoky deliciousness of BBQ. Go eat here!

go4Kxr9-i-WGpvzMgcxFoA.text: I haven't checked into YinzBurgh BBQ yet, but I can give an honest review after eating the food here. Let me explain, fellow  vegan and good friend, Jamie had gone here a few times and raved about the smoked Tofu with the greens and black eyed peas as sides. So we had made plans to meet and order some flicks at his apartment. So after his shift at Shadyside Hospital he went to YinzBurgh and picked up dinner and I went to 99bottles and got a couple sixers for the feast. I also stopped at Walmart (still sucks by the way) and picked up a can of Bush's grillin' beans and headed over.   The timing was perfect as he pulled up the same time I did, so the food would be good n' hot, all we had to do was throw the beans in the nuker and feast. I popped open a Dogfish Head 60 minute IPA , which goes great with a vinegar based BBQ sauce. I added the tomato based sauce to the baked beans to give em a little home made touch. The green were delicious and the black eyed peas equally good but the smoked tofu with that sauce was outstanding. Nice and firm, and just the right amount of smoke. yinzBurgh's tomato based BBQ sauce took a can of baked beans to new heights too. This is a great place that even caters to vegans and vegetarians who happen to love BBQ.

xGLHKqz6ERLyzVXWu4dV9Q.text: I checked this place out while visiting some friends in the area. I am from the South and have had more than my fair share of BBQ. This is some of the best BBQ I have ever had! The food was absolutely amazing! I would have never thought that vegan collards could be so good! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

riDE4bP2UQ6iiD6DrkNC9w.text: My dad and I heard great things about this place and we were excited to give it a try. I got the ribs/1/4 chicken and greens.  The ribs come without sauce on them and there are about 3 sauces that you can try and decide which you like best.  I liked the signature sauce the best, although that doesn't mean much.  The chicken was just OK.  I just thought the experience was meh.

F11S_S1drlRYVFK8ky_01Q.text: The owners are SUPER nice.  But the place is very unkept. :(   Our meats were delicious, but they didnt have cornbread, tea or cookies.   My boys loved the mac n cheese, but the cole slaw was awful.   IMO     Dont know that i'd go back.

gc_9Zzv8c3KYPhhTbrWPNA.text: Finally got to go to this place. It was fantastic,  the food was better than good and the service was grade A. They asked if we'd been there before,  when we said no, they went to great lengths to make sure we sampled all their sauces and any sides we were interested in. I had the pulled pork and ribs, my wife had the brisket and ribs, both meals were great.  The owner came out a few times to check on everyone,  as I said, unmatched service, including the person taking orders. The food earns 4 stars, the service kicks it to 5 stars. From this point in, the will be my go to place for BBQ, no doubt!

M_VgZiBmJiUcCvyKsna6Wg.text: The best BBQ on Baum Blvd!  Haha.    I've been staring at my screen toggling back and forth between 3 and 4 stars.  The  sides are really, really good.  Excellent collard greens, nicely flavored mac and cheese, great cole slaw, and flavorful black eyed peas.  Southern cooking.  As for the meat?  The dry rub on the ribs is quite good, and it was soft and tender.  The 1/4 chicken didn't have crispy skin and was a bit dry.  The pulled pork didn't have seasoning, which I didn't know if that is a style or not.  I agree with the other reviewer that the buns were store bought - and if not, they certainly tasted like a bun you get from a summer camp bbq.  It's hard not to root for the store and owner, who clearly has pride in his food.  He dissuades you from calling in an order too far ahead of your arrival, lest your food not be as fresh as possible.  And as described, it's not a sitdown place, with only a few tables and, well, no place to sitdown.  I can't compare this place to others in the 'burgh - Union Pig and Chicken and Showcase BBQ -- as I have to fit these meals into my P90X nutritional program.  I think this joint is worth checking out, however, of you're in the area.

i7-oFwwdv6y4OV-KdsVd1w.text: True fall-off-the-bone barbecue.  The ribs, chicken, and brisket were all great with only the dry rub, but adding one of their homemade sauces was even better.  The staff was friendly and offered a taste of each sauce before I made my decision.  Their smoke 'n sweet sauce is possibly my favorite barbecue sauce from anywhere.  Their cole slaw wasn't my favorite, but the red cabbage slaw had a sweet taste that complemented the savory meats.  The corn bread is buttery and sweet.  Best of all, the price was affordable for a BBQ restaurant.

RdLEg66jVR512frSBoL9HQ.text: Perhaps because a friend of mine talked it up so much, but I found this place only good.  The pork and brisket were okay. The chicken was disappointing and a little gummy. The mac and cheese was excellent, as were the collard greens. The sauces were unique and tasty. There is no good barbecue without good cornbread, and the cornbread was horribly dry and not very tasty.  I would get it again, but it's not my favorite. As well, I got it for takeout. I don't know if that makes a difference.

HkrlOACReii1KjIceapGDw.text: Delicious barbecue reminiscent of states down south. Smoked in house with a selection of house-made sauces diverse and delicious enough to please anyone. While other places think BBQ ends at slow-cooker pulled pork slopped on a bun with FMV sauce, this place knows what real BBQ is.

xF7VJGx_KyJTjlhNNPMudQ.text: I don't want to rain on this parade of generally positive reviews but I feel the need to weigh in with a dissenting view. It's not all bad: it's a mixed bad. The staff is crazy friendly and the decor looks like it was pieced together from scraps left behind by a local and not particularly successful amateur theater troupe. It's low-key to the point that you question whether you've actually entered a building certified to sell food. Behind the counter however, you can see the kitchen at work in a glorious bustle of brining and dry-rubbing that lets you know, yes, what you are eating is, in fact, genuine home-cooked barbecue that presumably meets all health and safety standards.  The owner is a really friendly guy; when you walk in, he asks if you've eaten there before and, if not, delivers his spiel on what he does: dry-rubbed barbecue, sauce on the side, have you tried the sauces by the way? The three varieties are sweet red, sweet yellowish, and sweet with vinegar. I get it, you can't have barbecue without sweetness but he may have driven the point home a little too thoroughly.  I got the pulled pork sandwich (priced at 8.50 including a side) and it was merely alright. I picked the coleslaw and carolina vinegar sauce because, really, that is the only way to eat a pulled pork sandwich. The bun is store-bought, slightly sweet, and thoroughly mediocre. Without the slaw on top, the bun and the tender pork would have been too uniformly textured to enjoy especially when doused in sauce. The pork itself tasted like smoked pork that had been dry-rubbed (surprise). I wouldn't call it bland, but it would've benefited from more salt. If you need smoked meat (don't we all), this is one of the few places in Pittsburgh to get it. The price is alright and the food is passable, if not great, barbecue.  I'm not writing this place off; I still need to try their ribs before judging them completely. I like barbecue but found my sandwich boring. Maybe the portions are better for the non-sandwich options but I could eat more for less elsewhere. I'd also like to explore their sides more. The black-eyed peas were fantastic.

KGjK7ePoSFM-36Gbl3SCoA.text: So nice to find a local bbq place.  As one who spent most of her life in the deep south, it was very refreshing to walk into YinzBurgh and see that this place knows and loves barbecue.  They were even familiar with my hometown barbecue spot!  The staff is incredibly friendly, and I did appreciate the short sauce lesson and explanation of the menu.  Though the pork was a little drier than I would like, it was still a good tasty meal.  I will definitely be back.

S5lZvP5PPFHpd23ea2i3lQ.text: A group of us visited YinzBurgh BBQ on a Sunday afternoon, after a short debate on which Pittsburgh-area BBQ place we should visit. YinzBurgh was the closest we haven't yet tried out, so that settled it.  Arriving, we didn't know what the parking situation would be, so we parked on side streets around the corner, but in their front door they have a sign indicating that customers are allowed to park in the Einstein Bros. lot across the street in the afternoons - convenient!   Walking in the restaurant, the barbecue smell hits you, and it smells amazing. The cheerful woman behind the counter asked if it was our first time visiting the establishment. When we told her it was, she offered samples of all five of their sauces, which is great because I would've just ordered one based on the description and the one I'd have picked definitely wasn't my favorite after the taste test. I ordered a beef brisket sandwich, while between all members of my party, we had a great selection of different meats, probably almost if not all of them. Another point - they do have vegetarian options (we didn't try them), but that's really cool to see a BBQ joint offering options for non-meat-eaters!  Now, our biggest problem - there were six of us but the seating area only accommodates four. Totally our fault for not realizing this going in and choosing to eat there instead of getting takeout, but they do actually have a pretty good sized space and I hope they offer a few more seating options as they continue to grow in popularity.  Onto the food: amazing. I got the beef brisket with their hot mustard-based BBQ sauce on the side, and it was without a doubt the best brisket I've had in Pittsburgh. The meat itself stands on its own, but I'm still into throwing a bit of sauce on. I managed to sample pretty much everything between what others in our party had ordered, and everything was great. The mac and cheese as a side was delicious, as was the cornbread (and a huge helping of it to boot). As we finished up, the cook (and potentially owner?) came out from the back and ensured everything was good, and was delighted to hear we enjoyed our meals.  Our whole experience here was great, and I'll definitely be back for more!

6rPsIc0pdui3AccNJz-Urg.text: Im from Texas so i know good BBQ. This is just okay. The brisket was somewhat succulent but could be smokier. Mac and cheese was tasty but on the dry side. Overall very decent, but im taking a star off for how pricey it is. $8 for a brisket sandwich?? Im use to having good all you can eat BBQ for around $10-$15. I guess thats what you have to pay for some decent bbq in the Burgh

-cIjNVUogU7RVvDOu9pPHQ.text: Great beef smoked short ribs! The rib is so flavorful and high quality! The sauces are definitely an add! The owner of this place has such a pleasant personality, and really knows how to prepare food! A must go place in Pittsburgh

RUahU8cIimEjESFwSFVp4w.text: Loved this place! The owner is super nice and very friendly! The food was amazing! My husband ordered the pulled pork and I ordered the brisket and both were delicious. The sauces are really good too! I am really glad we yelped this place and will be coming back soon.

ihz0Q9WUHu8KVa92r9XB1w.text: The best Southern BBQ in the Burgh! Richard does a spectacular job at preparing the food of his forefathers, with custom smoking techniques.
